com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.handler

Class BackwardTrafficHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.handler.BaseTrafficHandler
      • com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.handler.BackwardTrafficHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class BackwardTrafficHandler
extends BaseTrafficHandler
    Traffic handler to forward traffic from the Client socket to Server socket. Sockets are configured based on configuration.
    See Also:
    Config

    • Method Detail

      • task

        public void task()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles incoming requests from the socket bound to the client and forwards them to the server. Client and server sockets are defined by the sockets created according to the config file. See: Config

        According to RFC-2616, requests MAY NOT include a host header, and as such will add the target in order to ensure a 400 (Bad Request) with content The requested URL "[no URL]", is invalid. is not returned In order to ensure that the socket InputStream is signalled with a termination correctly, the Connection: Close header is added. This results in a -1 being identified by the stream read.
        Specified by:
        task in class BaseTrafficHandler
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any issues are encountered during the processing of a request

      • after

        public void after()
        Specified by:
        after in class BaseTrafficHandler
